bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 5, 1900

div1.p: Lazear describes a trip to Pinar del Rio. Mabel Lazear has had a long hospital stay.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 5, 1900
div1.p:
I enjoyed
your letter of the thertieth
very much. You are very
good to tell me all
about Houston. I like
to hear it all.
He certainly ought to
be well with all the
fresh air and good
food.

I had a nice trip last
week to Pinar del Rio.
I was gone three days.
The country is very
interesting. It is the
great tobacco country
called Vacto Abajo.

I met a great many
very interesting people
including the Governor
of the province with
whom I took several
meals. Eight companies
of the First Infantry
are stationed there.

This regiment is about
to start for China.

It seems to be definitely
decided that the cavalry
is to remain here
so the plans of our board will
not be interfered with by an
early evacuation of the island
This post will probably remain
as it is until next spring.

Mabel is having a long stay
at the hospital but she does
not seem to be tired out with
it, at least she does not
show it in her letters.

Nevertheless she is making
plans to get out as soon
as possible after the event.
I am looking for a telegram
all the time.
